## EU5 Script Values Reference
## Source: https://eu5.paradoxwikis.com/Script_values + Vanilla Game Files
## Last Updated: December 10, 2025

‚ö†Ô∏è **NOTE: The wiki page for Script values is currently empty!**
This reference is compiled from vanilla game file analysis in common/script_values/ and practical modding experience.

======================
STANDARD SCRIPT VALUE CONSTANTS
======================

From main_menu/common/script_values/default_values.txt - These are the standard constants used throughout EU5:

STABILITY VALUES:
----------------------------------
stability_radical_penalty = -100
stability_ultimate_penalty = -50
stability_very_extreme_penalty = -25
stability_extreme_penalty = -20
stability_severe_penalty = -12
stability_mild_penalty = -7
stability_weak_penalty = -2.5
stability_weak_bonus = 2.5
stability_mild_bonus = 7
stability_severe_bonus = 12
stability_extreme_bonus = 20
stability_very_extreme_bonus = 25
stability_ultimate_bonus = 50
stability_radical_bonus = 100

PRESTIGE VALUES:
----------------------------------
prestige_radical_penalty = -100
prestige_ultimate_penalty = -50
prestige_extreme_penalty = -20
prestige_severe_penalty = -15
prestige_mild_penalty = -10
prestige_weak_penalty = -5
prestige_weak_bonus = 5
prestige_mild_bonus = 10
prestige_severe_bonus = 15
prestige_extreme_bonus = 20
prestige_ultimate_bonus = 50
prestige_radical_bonus = 100

MONTHLY PRESTIGE VALUES:
----------------------------------
monthly_prestige_radical_penalty = -1.0
monthly_prestige_ultimate_penalty = -0.5
monthly_prestige_extreme_penalty = -0.33
monthly_prestige_severe_penalty = -0.25
monthly_prestige_mild_penalty = -0.1
monthly_prestige_weak_penalty = -0.05
monthly_prestige_very_weak_penalty = -0.02
monthly_prestige_very_weak_bonus = 0.02
monthly_prestige_weak_bonus = 0.05
monthly_prestige_mild_bonus = 0.1
monthly_prestige_severe_bonus = 0.25
monthly_prestige_extreme_bonus = 0.33
monthly_prestige_ultimate_bonus = 0.5
monthly_prestige_radical_bonus = 1.0

GOVERNMENT POWER VALUES:
----------------------------------
government_power_radical_penalty = -50
government_power_ultimate_penalty = -25
government_power_extreme_penalty = -10
government_power_severe_penalty = -7.5
government_power_mild_penalty = -5
government_power_weak_penalty = -2.5
government_power_weak_bonus = 2.5
government_power_mild_bonus = 5
government_power_severe_bonus = 7.5
government_power_extreme_bonus = 10
government_power_ultimate_bonus = 25
government_power_radical_bonus = 50

LEGITIMACY VALUES:
----------------------------------
legitimacy_radical_penalty = -100
legitimacy_ultimate_penalty = -50
legitimacy_extreme_penalty = -20
legitimacy_severe_penalty = -15
legitimacy_mild_penalty = -10
legitimacy_weak_penalty = -5
legitimacy_weak_bonus = 5
legitimacy_mild_bonus = 10
legitimacy_severe_bonus = 15
legitimacy_extreme_bonus = 20
legitimacy_ultimate_bonus = 50
legitimacy_radical_bonus = 100

DEVOTION VALUES:
----------------------------------
devotion_radical_penalty = -100
devotion_ultimate_penalty = -50
devotion_extreme_penalty = -20
devotion_severe_penalty = -15
devotion_mild_penalty = -10
devotion_weak_penalty = -5
devotion_weak_bonus = 5
devotion_mild_bonus = 10
devotion_severe_bonus = 15
devotion_extreme_bonus = 20
devotion_ultimate_bonus = 50
devotion_radical_bonus = 100

REPUBLICAN TRADITION VALUES:
----------------------------------
republican_tradition_radical_penalty = -100
republican_tradition_ultimate_penalty = -50
republican_tradition_extreme_penalty = -20
republican_tradition_severe_penalty = -15
republican_tradition_mild_penalty = -10
republican_tradition_weak_penalty = -5
republican_tradition_weak_bonus = 5
republican_tradition_mild_bonus = 10
republican_tradition_severe_bonus = 15
republican_tradition_extreme_bonus = 20
republican_tradition_ultimate_bonus = 50
republican_tradition_radical_bonus = 100

GAME DEFINE CONSTANTS:
----------------------------------
From in_game/common/script_values/define_values.txt:

# Character Actions
DISINHERIT_PRESTIGE_HIT = -50
ABDICATE_PRESTIGE_HIT = -50
ABDICATE_GOVERNMENT_POWER_HIT = -20
REMOVE_CONSORT_PRESTIGE_HIT = -30

# War & Diplomacy
MONTHS_BEFORE_OVERLORD_CAN_JOIN_CIVIL_WAR = 6
HIGH_WAR_EXHAUSTION = 10

# Horde Civil War
HORDE_CIVIL_WAR_END_STABILITY = 25
HORDE_CIVIL_WAR_END_HORDE_UNITY = 90
HORDE_CIVIL_WAR_PRE_END_STABILITY = 15
HORDE_CIVIL_WAR_PRE_END_HORDE_UNITY = 70

# International Organizations
INTERNATIONAL_ORGANIZATION_SAME_AGENDA_COOLDOWN_YEARS = 2

# Personal Union Laws
UNION_SAME_INHERITANCE_LEVEL = 2
UNION_SAME_LAWS_LEVEL = 5
MIN_YEARS_IN_ORGANIZATION_REQUIRED = 5

# Holy Roman Empire
LONG_IMPERIAL_REGENCY_YEARS = 5

# Subject Relations
MIN_SUBJECT_LOYALTY_FOR_ACTION = 50
MAX_SUBJECT_LIBERTY_DESIRE_FOR_ACTION = 50
LIBERTY_DESIRE_AUTONOMY_GRANTED_VALUE = -10
LIBERTY_DESIRE_AUTONOMY_REVOKED_VALUE = 25

# Red Turban Rebellions
RTR_IS_LOYAL_VALUE = 50
RTR_IS_NEUTRAL_VALUE = 0

======================
WHAT ARE SCRIPT VALUES?
======================

Script values are dynamic calculations that return numerical values based on game state.
They allow complex math, conditional logic, and data queries to compute values on-the-fly.

Think of script values as "formulas" or "calculated fields":
- Instead of hardcoded "100 gold", use a formula: "100 * country_development"
- Instead of fixed "5% bonus", calculate: "base_value + (ruler_skill * 0.01)"

Script values are used in:
- Triggers (comparing calculated values)
- Effects (setting dynamic amounts)
- Modifiers (calculating modifier strength)
- Events (determining outcomes)

======================
WHERE TO DEFINE SCRIPT VALUES
======================

LOCATION
----------------------------------
All script values are defined in:
common/script_values/

FILE STRUCTURE
----------------------------------
# File: common/script_values/my_values.txt

my_calculated_value = {
    value = 100                    # Base value
    
    add = 50                       # Add 50
    multiply = 2                   # Multiply result by 2
    
    if = {
        limit = { stability >= 2 }
        add = 25                   # Add 25 if stable
    }
}

another_value = {
    value = ROOT.GetGold           # Use game data
    multiply = 0.1                 # 10% of gold
}

======================
BASIC SYNTAX
======================

SIMPLE VALUE
----------------------------------
my_value = {
    value = 100
}

# Returns: 100

ARITHMETIC OPERATIONS
----------------------------------
my_calculation = {
    value = 50
    add = 25           # Now 75
    subtract = 10      # Now 65
    multiply = 2       # Now 130
    divide = 5         # Now 26
}

ORDER OF OPERATIONS
----------------------------------
Operations execute TOP TO BOTTOM (not mathematical order):

my_value = {
    value = 10
    add = 5            # 15
    multiply = 2       # 30 (not 10 + (5*2) = 20!)
}

To control order, nest operations or use separate script values.

======================
CONDITIONAL LOGIC
======================

IF BLOCKS
----------------------------------
my_conditional_value = {
    value = 100
    
    if = {
        limit = { stability >= 2 }
        add = 50
    }
    
    if = {
        limit = { stability < 0 }
        subtract = 50
    }
}

ELSE_IF
----------------------------------
my_tiered_value = {
    value = 0
    
    if = {
        limit = { development >= 20 }
        add = 100
    }
    else_if = {
        limit = { development >= 10 }
        add = 50
    }
    else = {
        add = 25
    }
}

NESTED CONDITIONS
----------------------------------
complex_value = {
    value = 100
    
    if = {
        limit = {
            is_at_war = yes
            war_exhaustion >= 5
        }
        
        multiply = 0.5
        
        if = {
            limit = { stability < 0 }
            multiply = 0.5  # Stack penalties
        }
    }
}

======================
DATA ACCESS
======================

SCOPE DATA FUNCTIONS
----------------------------------
Script values can access game data via scope functions:

country_gold_value = {
    value = ROOT.GetGold
}

ruler_skill_bonus = {
    value = ROOT.GetRuler.GetAdm
    add = ROOT.GetRuler.GetDip
    add = ROOT.GetRuler.GetMil
}

location_development = {
    value = ROOT.GetDevelopment
}

MODIFIER VALUES
----------------------------------
Access modifier type values using modifier: prefix:

discipline_value = {
    value = modifier:discipline
    multiply = 100  # Convert to percentage
}

combined_income = {
    value = modifier:tax_income_efficiency
    add = modifier:production_efficiency
    add = modifier:trade_income_modifier
}

VARIABLES
----------------------------------
Access saved variables:

investigation_progress = {
    value = ROOT.GetVariable('investigation_count')
    multiply = 10
}

custom_calculation = {
    value = var:my_stored_value
    add = 50
}

DEFINES
----------------------------------
Access game defines:

manpower_calculation = {
    value = define:NCountry|BASE_MANPOWER
    multiply = ROOT.GetDevelopment
}

======================
ADVANCED OPERATIONS
======================

MIN/MAX
----------------------------------
capped_value = {
    value = ROOT.GetGold
    min = 100          # Never less than 100
    max = 1000         # Never more than 1000
}

ROUND/FLOOR/CEILING
----------------------------------
rounded_value = {
    value = 123.456
    round = yes        # 123
}

floored_value = {
    value = 123.456
    floor = yes        # 123
}

ceiling_value = {
    value = 123.456
    ceiling = yes      # 124
}

ABSOLUTE VALUE
----------------------------------
absolute_value = {
    value = -50
    abs = yes          # 50
}

CLAMP
----------------------------------
clamped_value = {
    value = ROOT.GetStability
    min = -3
    max = 3
}

======================
SCOPE CHAINING
======================

DOT NOTATION
----------------------------------
ruler_admin_value = {
    value = ROOT.GetRuler.GetAdm
}

capital_development = {
    value = ROOT.GetCapital.GetDevelopment
}

SCOPE ITERATION
----------------------------------
# Count items in a scope list
province_count = {
    value = 0
    
    every_owned_location = {
        ROOT = {
            add = 1
        }
    }
}

# Sum values from list
total_development = {
    value = 0
    
    every_owned_location = {
        ROOT = {
            add = PREV.GetDevelopment
        }
    }
}

SAVED SCOPES
----------------------------------
target_country_gold = {
    value = scope:target_country.GetGold
}

rival_strength = {
    value = scope:rival.GetMilitaryPower
}

======================
USING SCRIPT VALUES
======================

IN TRIGGERS
----------------------------------
trigger = {
    # Compare to script value
    gold >= my_gold_requirement
    
    # Use script value in comparison
    ROOT.ScriptValue('my_calculated_value') >= 100
}

IN EFFECTS
----------------------------------
effect = {
    # Add dynamic amount
    add_gold = my_gold_bonus
    
    # Use in set effects
    set_variable = {
        name = my_var
        value = my_calculated_value
    }
    
    # Scale effects
    add_manpower = {
        value = 1000
        multiply = manpower_bonus_multiplier
    }
}

IN MODIFIERS
----------------------------------
# Modifier that uses script value
my_modifier = {
    modifier = {
        discipline = my_discipline_calculation
    }
}

# Note: Script values in modifiers recalculate dynamically

IN LOCALIZATION
----------------------------------
l_english:
 my_event_desc: "Gold bonus: [ROOT.ScriptValue('my_gold_bonus')]"
 calculated_text: "Your score is [ROOT.ScriptValue('player_score')|0]"

======================
COMMON PATTERNS
======================

SCALING BY DEVELOPMENT
----------------------------------
development_scaled_bonus = {
    value = ROOT.GetDevelopment
    multiply = 0.5
    max = 100
}

RULER SKILL BONUS
----------------------------------
ruler_total_skill = {
    value = ROOT.GetRuler.GetAdm
    add = ROOT.GetRuler.GetDip
    add = ROOT.GetRuler.GetMil
    
    # Bonus if all skills high
    if = {
        limit = {
            ROOT.GetRuler.GetAdm >= 4
            ROOT.GetRuler.GetDip >= 4
            ROOT.GetRuler.GetMil >= 4
        }
        add = 5
    }
}

PERCENTAGE CALCULATION
----------------------------------
tax_efficiency_percentage = {
    value = modifier:tax_income_efficiency
    multiply = 100
    round = yes
}

PROGRESSIVE SCALING
----------------------------------
progressive_cost = {
    value = 100  # Base cost
    
    if = {
        limit = { ROOT.GetNumProvinces <= 10 }
        multiply = 1.0
    }
    else_if = {
        limit = { ROOT.GetNumProvinces <= 25 }
        multiply = 1.5
    }
    else_if = {
        limit = { ROOT.GetNumProvinces <= 50 }
        multiply = 2.0
    }
    else = {
        multiply = 3.0
    }
}

RISK/REWARD CALCULATION
----------------------------------
rebellion_risk_value = {
    value = 0
    
    # Base risk from unrest
    add = ROOT.GetAverageUnrest
    
    # Increase if at war
    if = {
        limit = { is_at_war = yes }
        add = 5
    }
    
    # Increase if low stability
    if = {
        limit = { stability < 0 }
        add = ROOT.GetStability
        abs = yes
        multiply = 2
    }
    
    # Decrease if high legitimacy
    if = {
        limit = { legitimacy >= 75 }
        subtract = 3
    }
}

======================
PRACTICAL EXAMPLES
======================

EXAMPLE 1: Dynamic Event Reward
----------------------------------
# Script value definition:
event_gold_reward = {
    value = 50                     # Base reward
    
    # Scale by development
    add = ROOT.GetDevelopment
    multiply = 2
    
    # Bonus for high admin ruler
    if = {
        limit = { ROOT.GetRuler.GetAdm >= 5 }
        add = 100
    }
    
    # Cap maximum
    max = 500
}

# In event:
event = {
    id = my_event.1
    
    option = {
        name = "Accept reward"
        add_gold = event_gold_reward
        
        # Show amount in tooltip
        tooltip = {
            add_gold = event_gold_reward
        }
    }
}

# In localization:
l_english:
 my_event_desc: "We gain [ROOT.ScriptValue('event_gold_reward')|0] gold!"

EXAMPLE 2: Tiered Military Bonus
----------------------------------
military_investment_bonus = {
    value = 0
    
    # Count military buildings
    every_owned_location = {
        limit = { has_building = barracks }
        ROOT = { add = 1 }
    }
    
    # Multiply by ruler military skill
    multiply = ROOT.GetRuler.GetMil
    
    # Add discipline modifier
    add = modifier:discipline
    multiply = 100
    
    # Round to integer
    round = yes
}

# Usage in effect:
add_army_tradition = military_investment_bonus

EXAMPLE 3: Province Value Calculator
----------------------------------
province_strategic_value = {
    value = ROOT.GetDevelopment
    multiply = 10
    
    # Bonus for capital
    if = {
        limit = { is_capital = yes }
        add = 100
    }
    
    # Bonus for coastal
    if = {
        limit = { is_coastal = yes }
        add = 25
    }
    
    # Bonus for trade center
    if = {
        limit = { has_building = trade_depot }
        add = 50
    }
    
    # Penalty for low control
    if = {
        limit = { control < 50 }
        multiply = 0.5
    }
}

EXAMPLE 4: Dynamic Mission Requirement
----------------------------------
mission_development_requirement = {
    value = 20                     # Base requirement
    
    # Scale by game year
    add = ROOT.GetCurrentDate.GetYear
    subtract = 1444                # Years since start
    divide = 10                    # 1 per decade
    
    # Cap growth
    max = 40
}

# In mission:
my_mission = {
    trigger = {
        total_development >= mission_development_requirement
    }
}

EXAMPLE 5: Cost Scaling System
----------------------------------
action_cost_multiplier = {
    value = 1.0                    # Base multiplier
    
    # Increase for large nations
    if = {
        limit = { num_owned_provinces >= 50 }
        multiply = 1.5
    }
    
    # Increase if at war
    if = {
        limit = { is_at_war = yes }
        multiply = 1.25
    }
    
    # Decrease for good economy
    if = {
        limit = {
            gold >= 1000
            monthly_gold_income >= 50
        }
        multiply = 0.9
    }
    
    # Round to 2 decimals
    round = 2
}

# Usage:
effect = {
    add_gold = {
        value = -500
        multiply = action_cost_multiplier
    }
}

EXAMPLE 6: Complex Scoring System
----------------------------------
player_achievement_score = {
    value = 0
    
    # Points for development
    add = ROOT.GetTotalDevelopment
    multiply = 2
    
    # Points for provinces
    add = ROOT.GetNumProvinces
    multiply = 10
    
    # Points for prestige
    add = ROOT.GetPrestige
    
    # Points for great power status
    if = {
        limit = { is_great_power = yes }
        add = 500
    }
    
    # Bonus for completed missions
    add = ROOT.GetCompletedMissionsCount
    multiply = 50
    
    # Penalty for being at war
    if = {
        limit = { is_at_war = yes }
        multiply = 0.9
    }
    
    round = yes
}

======================
DEBUGGING SCRIPT VALUES
======================

TESTING IN EVENTS
----------------------------------
# Create debug event:
debug_event.1 = {
    title = "Debug Script Value"
    desc = "Value is: [ROOT.ScriptValue('my_value')]"
    
    trigger = {
        always = yes
    }
    
    option = {
        name = "OK"
        log = "Script value result: [ROOT.ScriptValue('my_value')]"
    }
}

LOGGING
----------------------------------
effect = {
    log = "My value: [ROOT.ScriptValue('my_calculated_value')]"
    log = "Base: [ROOT.GetGold]"
    log = "Development: [ROOT.GetDevelopment]"
}

CONSOLE TESTING
----------------------------------
reload script_values                # Reload script values
run_event debug_event.1             # Test debug event

COMMON ERRORS
----------------------------------
‚ùå ERROR: Script value returns 0 unexpectedly
Causes:
- Division by zero
- Wrong scope context
- Undefined variable

‚úÖ FIX: Add logging, check scope, validate variables exist

‚ùå ERROR: Value too large/small
Cause: Missing min/max caps

‚úÖ FIX: Add min/max to reasonable range

‚ùå ERROR: Wrong calculation order
Cause: Operations execute top-to-bottom

‚úÖ FIX: Reorder operations or use nested script values

‚ùå ERROR: Scope doesn't exist
Cause: Accessing scope that may not be valid

‚úÖ FIX: Add exists checks in limit blocks

======================
BEST PRACTICES
======================

1. NAMING
----------------------------------
‚úÖ Use descriptive names:
development_scaled_bonus
ruler_skill_total
province_strategic_value

‚ùå Avoid vague names:
value1
calc
bonus

2. DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------
‚úÖ Comment complex calculations:
# Calculates gold reward based on:
# - Base 50 gold
# - +2 per development
# - +100 if high admin ruler
# - Capped at 500

‚ùå Don't leave calculations unexplained

3. RANGE CAPPING
----------------------------------
‚úÖ Always set reasonable min/max:
my_value = {
    value = calculated_amount
    min = 10
    max = 1000
}

‚ùå Don't allow unbounded growth

4. PERFORMANCE
----------------------------------
‚úÖ Minimize scope iteration:
# Bad: Iterate twice
total_dev = { every_owned_location = { ... } }
total_tax = { every_owned_location = { ... } }

# Good: Combine if possible
combined_value = {
    every_owned_location = {
        ROOT = {
            add = PREV.GetDevelopment
            add = PREV.GetTaxIncome
        }
    }
}

5. TESTING
----------------------------------
‚úÖ Test edge cases:
- Value = 0
- Very large values
- Very small values
- Missing scopes
- Invalid data

6. LOCALIZATION
----------------------------------
‚úÖ Format numbers appropriately:
[ROOT.ScriptValue('gold_value')|0]  # No decimals
[ROOT.ScriptValue('percentage')|2]  # Two decimals

======================
SCRIPT VALUES vs DEFINES
======================

DEFINES
----------------------------------
- Static values in common/defines/
- Set at game start
- Don't change based on game state
- Fast to access

define:NCountry|BASE_MANPOWER = 1000

SCRIPT VALUES
----------------------------------
- Dynamic calculations
- Recalculate each time accessed
- Can use conditionals and game state
- Slower than defines (but flexible)

manpower_bonus = {
    value = define:NCountry|BASE_MANPOWER
    multiply = ROOT.GetDevelopment
}

WHEN TO USE EACH
----------------------------------
Use DEFINES for:
- Fixed game constants
- Base values that never change
- Performance-critical values

Use SCRIPT VALUES for:
- Dynamic calculations
- Conditional logic
- Scaling based on game state
- Complex formulas

======================
CROSS-REFERENCES
======================
üìÑ Related Files:
- EU5_TRIGGERS_REFERENCE.txt - Using script values in triggers
- EU5_EFFECTS_REFERENCE.txt - Using script values in effects
- EU5_SCOPES_REFERENCE.txt - Understanding scope context
- EU5_VARIABLES_REFERENCE.txt - Storing calculated values
- EU5_DEFINES_REFERENCE.txt - Static game values
- EU5_LOCALIZATION_REFERENCE.txt - Displaying script values
- common/script_values/ - Vanilla script value definitions
- game/in_game/common/script_values/_script_values.info - Official documentation
